subject: DVR: Create separate routing table for routers in fip namespace
commit_message:
DVR: Create separate routing table for routers in fip namespace

The fip namespace is shared between tenants on a given compute node.
So far the fip namespace was only used for forwarding floatingip
traffic, but with the fast-path exit, this namespace will also be
used for forwarding the traffic directly to the external network
without floating IPs if the address scopes match.

In order to provide flexibility in adding the different next hop
routes for the external network, each router will now have a dedicated
table that hosts the routing rules.

The traffic is matched based on the incoming interface and forwarded
to the route lookup table.

The table index is generated from the fpr-interface ip so it should
be unique on a given node.

libvirt: fix live-migration with serial console check

If the graphical consoles VNC and SPICE are disabled and the serial console
is enabled, the live-migration of an instance will result in an ERROR state.
This is due to the move in commit 917afd2831b. The "can migrate" verification

in the "check_can_live_migrate_destination" step, so that the step

subject: Ironic conductor to honor the interval values for periodic tasks
commit_message:
Ironic conductor to honor the interval values for periodic tasks

This patch fixes a problem which was preventing Ironic from honoring the
interval values configuration for the periodic tasks. Since the interval
values are passed to a decorator the configuration options should be
evaluated prior to importing the module which contains the periodic tasks.

In our case this is not happening because there's a chain of imports going
from ironic.cmd.conductor -> ironic.common.service -> ironic.api.app
-> ... -> ironic.conductor.manager which is making the @periodic
decorators to be evaluated before the configuration options.

This patch breaks that chain of imports by importing ironic.api.app inside
the scope it's being instead of the beginning of the file. We also add an
assert statement as a safeguard to guarantee that ironic.conductor.manager
is not loaded earlier in the startup of the process and prevent similar
errors to sneak in again.

Closes-Bug: #1562258

This adds a hook to add the populate_existing() call to
all SQLAlchemy queries issued by Neutron.

This is necessary because we don't expire objects on
commit so a DB object will prevent new lookup queries
from getting new data about that object until it is
garbage collected or explicitly expired.

Populate_existing() informs SQLAlchemy to update all
objects in the session with the data retrieved from
a query. More details can be found at the following link
and in the docstring inline.
http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/query.html#

subject: Allow for invalid packet sequence in keepalive
commit_message:
Allow for invalid packet sequence in keepalive

In the SQLAlchemy keep_alive class, MariaDB is failing
as pymysql reports an invalid packet sequence.
MariaDB seems to timeout the client in a different
way than MySQL and PXC, which manifests itself as the
aforementioned invalid sequence.  It is now handled
as a special-case exception.

With this fix, the MariaDB scenario tests now pass.

The scenario tests were also tweaked a bit, which aided
in the testing of the fix.  'group=instance' was created,
plus instance_error properly interleaved with
instance_create.  _has_status now calls get_instance with
the admin client so that any faults are accompanied by
a relevant stack trace.  Cases where the result code
was being checked out-of-sequence were removed, and explicit
calls to check the http code for the right client were added.

The replication error messages for promote and eject were
enhanced as well to attempt to debug spurious failures.
One of those failures was 'Replication is not on after 60 seconds.'
This was fixed by setting 'MASTER_CONNECT_RETRY' in the mariadb
gtid replication strategy as was done in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188933

Finally, backup_incremental was added to MariaDB supported
groups and cleaned up elsewhere.

subject: Set Deployment Parameters
commit_message:
Set Deployment Parameters

Previously in python-tripleoclient, they tried to use UpdateIdentifier
or two different things: tell whether to perform package update, and
also to tell whether the top-level stack is being created or updated
(which was incorrect and resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to
work around that bug resulted in bug 1567385).

Heat's "action" conditionals cannot be used in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

UpdateIdentifier is cleared on deploy/scale to make sure that package
update doesn't get triggered, and we pass the StackAction parameter to
allow us to correctly distinguish between create vs. update of the
top-level stack, and condition the pacemaker restarts on this variable
instead.

This patch sets the parameters mentioned above and stores them in a
Mistral Environment.  These parameters are retrieved during the
ProcessTemplatesAction and subsequently merged into the Heat
environment.
